Mar 25

Breaking News

NBA Suspends Joakim Noah for Violating Anti-Drug Policy

The center will miss at least the rest of this season, games he was already missing due to injury

According to Adrian Wojnarowski of The Vertical, the NBA has suspended New York Knicks center Joakim Noah for 20 games for violating the league’s anti-drug policy.

Noah tested positive for an over-the-counter supplement that the NBA prohibits under the Collective Bargaining Agreement. The league is expected to announce his suspension on Saturday.

The suspension will likely see Noah out of the team’s last ten games to close out this season and out of the Knicks’ first ten games of the 2017–18 season.

Young Titans: Can Kristaps and Willy Flourish Together?
We take a look at the obvious chemistry between the young guns and ask if the big men pair are capable of shaping the…theknickswall.com

The National Basketball Player’s Association concluded that in their investigation Noah did not “knowingly or willingly” take the substance and was cooperative in the league probe.

Noah, 32, signed a four-year, $72 million contract this summer and prior to seeing his season ended on February 27 due to arthroscopic surgery on his left knee, he averaged 5.0 points per game, 8.7 rebounds per game 2.2 assists per game while shooting 49.7 percent from the field over 46 games (per Basketball-Reference.)

As another blow to what was expected to be a playoff season for the Knicks, the 27–45, lottery placed team will face off against the San Antonio Spurs tonight in San Antonio at 8:30 p.m. EST.

Updates will follow when more information is released on this breaking story.

— Ankit Mehra, site writer
